Reviews.Title: “FLOPHOUSE for CRACKHEADS”
Reviews.Author: George H
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel w/a flight and car rental,and this place was'nt the cheapest either.We reserved a non smoking king size bed we got a gross smellin queen..Went to the front desk and told them that someone had been in there smoking and it was not a non smoking even though the sign by the door said non smoking.Our answer to that was"We can't keep an eye on everyone"WOW really..You need a key to get in and out the side someone kept putting a stone to prop the door open there was nothing they could do adout that either.We did not feel safe,we couldn't change hotels either nor would they change our rm.1 st night the sheets on the bed was for a full size went to the front desk not them nor housekeeping knew the diffrents in the sheet size..Pepole in and out all hours of the night banging screaming....Did not feel safe at all..The girls at the front desk were letting friends in to use the exersice machines and drink ect...If I had small kids I would cry,Prop a chair at night at the door and slept w/the tv and a light that way they thought someone was awake..Would NEVER stay here again....want a crappy vacation here in Phoenix...We don't think we'll be back.....Who owns these places?The walmart down the road is just as scarey...rude no pride

Reviews.Title: “Oops”
Reviews.Author: retiree1986
Reviews.Content: First let me apologize to all those who wrote negative reviews of this property! I did not take them seriously enough. After all, how bad can a 2+* hotel be? The attached photos have been altered ONLY to the extent to call attention to what I found to be unsatisfactory. Believe me when I say that the local management and Choice Hotel corporate office knows about these deficiencies. Compare the pictures on the Mainstay site with those of my room. I feel that no further review is necessary other than the bed was bad and the pillows were lumpy.

Reviews.Title: “SHADY PLACE, dirty, no way do you want to stay here”
Reviews.Author: mamabear1989
Reviews.Content: Pimps, drug dealers, prostitutes. There is no way management doesn't know what is going on and they just don't care. We complained about one person there and were told there was nothing they could do about it "they had been watching him for awhile but couldn't catch him at anything". Really! If that is how you choose to fill up your rooms go for it, but the general public should be warned. The couches and chairs were stained and disgusting, I was afraid to sit anywhere except on my bed with everything but the sheets (which did at least appear clean) pulled off of it.

Reviews.Title: “Ratty”
Reviews.Author: RoadrunnersNewMexico
Reviews.Content: We travel to Phoenix once a year to attend a meeting and catch up with colleagues. For several years, we enjoyed staying at the Homestead Suites on Dunlap, but our experience was so bad last year that we vowed never to stay there again. An acquaintance recommended Mainstay Suites, so we booked a room for a couple of nights for this year’s meeting. We never thought it could be worse. We were “greeted” by baggy-panted and gothic hotel guests smoking outside the front door. The check-in area was cramped and the elevator floor was very dirty. There was an air of dinginess everywhere … down the darkly lit hallways … dusty-leaved fake trees by the elevators. The spa was broken and both the spa and the pool had sand in them; the pool chairs were grimy. So, we had just taken our bathing suits for a ride. Our suite smelled “off,” like a very sweaty person had stayed there. We found trash still in the kitchen trash bin, a used coffee packet was still in the coffee maker, and someone had left behind a pair of jeans in one of the drawers. The carpet was threadbare, and the bathroom vent had been removed and the wires were exposed in the ceiling. Even after taking a shower, we felt dirty, just because the room was such a downer. We kept our shoes on while we were in the room because we didn’t want our bare feet to touch the carpet. This property is surrounded by three Marriott properties. We stopped at one of them to check it out for next year and it was so clean, well maintained and well lit, that we didn’t want to leave. Although the desk staff were quite helpful, it’s still a terrible place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean budget hotel... Just a little scared to stay there again alone”
Reviews.Author: clippermama
Reviews.Content: Nice clean rooms close to highway and metro mall.. good kitchen in room. Just a little scarey by myself. Don't get me wrong it was nice just traveling alone you need to be a little more particular think ill stay at the Sheraton across the street next time

Reviews.Title: “This Place is a DUMP”
Reviews.Author: LJS2012
Reviews.Content: Great Front Desk crew but that's where the great ends. Forget what they advertise, the fully stocked kitchen, cable TV, iron, alarm clock and the cookies don't exist! What you get is a barely clean room, no/stained towels, torn sheets and dirty, stained and ripped carpet. Lights out in the parking lot and trash just about everywhere you turn. Don't try for the guaranteed room because the manager isn't around to talk to. Also, don't waste your time with Choice Hotels about the problem because they don't care. A good night's sleep is impossible with all the noise in the hallways. Even if you get a good rate, you are overpaying. Bottom line, Don't stay here--you have been warned!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: rv50
Reviews.Content: Nice room with furnished kitchen and breakfast choice included has a reasonable variety. Staff is friendly. We had to ask to get towels for the shower. Restaurants closeby. We stayed at this hotel twice during the last 6 months and did not pay more than 60 $ per night and we though we had a good deal. Well located near highway 17 but hard to find.

Reviews.Title: “Prostitution, Drugs and Strange People”
Reviews.Author: travlr31310
Reviews.Content: The cars, heavy gold chain jewelry, tattoos, scary people, foul language from many different people in various places in the hotel tell me that the place is a pimp, drug using, prostitution business. The place smells bad with smoke and mold. The carpets are filthy. Exterior looks and photos are deceiving. Don't let your kids out of the room alone.

Reviews.Title: “Quality gone way DOWN hill...”
Reviews.Author: Photomitch
Reviews.Content: I stayed here several yers ago when the plac was brand new and the paint was fresh. You were served Chocolate Chips cookies at the front desk in the evenings and the staff was ready to help. it's years later (about 5 years) and the place is already run down and having problems. I travel to Phoenix for business from time to time and always love to get a suite where I can make my own meals, but th kitchen was lacking, the sink in the bathroom was backing up, even after alerting the front desk the matter was not taken of. The air conditoning system wasnt working properly and there were crayon marks all over the furnture.I highly do not reccomend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Pew!”
Reviews.Author: AllieTacoma
Reviews.Content: we stayed on the 3rd floor at Mainstay suites which absolutely reeked of cigarettes. our room was a "nonsmoking" room but it still smelled like an ashtray. the other floors were not too bad. The carpets are disgustingly dirty throughout the hotel. I would not let a small child crawl on the floor of our room. That said, the rest of the room was clean, the rooms are spacious, the bed was actually surprisingly comfortable and the plumbing and AC worked great. It does have free WiFi and an adequate free breakfast. So overall it is a good deal but I won't be back- will spend another $40 a night to stay at a place that doesn't stink.

Reviews.Title: “impeccable”
Reviews.Author: eb4eva
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for my surgery i had last month. they took good care of me and were very kind and accomodating. rooms were clean and comfortable. i would stay here again. good job!!

Reviews.Title: “FILTHY, DISGUSTING, STEALS, ROCHES,STINK!!!!!! RUN”
Reviews.Author: sal c
Reviews.Content: 16 people went there for a wedding, this was the worse hotel I have ever stayed in, I have stayed in cheaper but nicer & cleaner, the first day bathroom in Lobby there was a roach on the floor I did not say anything cause of the wedding, the carpets lets just say I did not walk barefoot, the washclothes & towels were dingy they need a new washer and need to use bleach, i used my sponge after that, these are smoke free rooms but they smelled awful one couple did leave we found out later, elevator they smoke on, the intranet you always had to ask can i use for a min we needed directions for attractions to visit, every morning we had to ask them to stock up the breakfast it was not much, twice we seen roaches, we told the maintence there he said they just sprayed so he could not understand why that is I went to show him the 2 my husband and i see on the wall in 2 different hallways he just shook his head and killed them, the last night we were there someone had punch our peep hole through it was laying on the floor when we got back, everyday when we left we kept the do not disturd sign so no one would go in, good thing cause 3 sisters that were in a room there expensive perfume got stolen, the trash on the outside in the hallways were always full, all i can say about this hotel the staff was friendly, this place was so bad i was scared to pull back the sheets to look at the mattress scared of what i may see, so i didnt, my husband did tell the person when we checked out everything he gave us, the 3 rooms we had 25% off the bill, my sister says they charge her 3 times and that she will have to wait 10 days, we just got back yesterday so we shall see, I have never ever written a review before i am 48 years old, this was the worse i have ever seen, it will never happen again do not care who it may offend, run do not stay here, my husband does plan on calling the health department, this place needs to be closed down and remolded, i think cause its cheap, and it has kitchetts that people stay there by the week they do not care and my husband the whole time we were there we only seen 1 maid and one cart.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel has great potential, but service needs vast improvement”
Reviews.Author: Anapalacios1
Reviews.Content: The hotel has great potential in that it has the "comforts of home" (i.e., kitchen (2-burner electric stove), silverware, cookware and cooking utensils (allbeit limited), microwave, toaster, coffeemaker, dining table (if you want to save $$ eating out, which is why we picked this place). There was not much dresser space, but we made it work; closet space was fine, shower worked great, bed was comfortable. The carpet was extremely dirty, but you'd only know it if you were walking barefoot in the room. Parking was fine, the pool is a nice size, with plenty of lounging chairs and space to lay out. There is continental breakfast - over by 9 a.m. during the week; it goes longer on the weekends (at least until 10 a.m.). The fitness center was tiny: only 1 eliptical, 1 treadmill, and 1 stationary bike. They don't automatically replenish the coffee packs in your room, and the decanters of coffee in the lobby were empty quite frequently (though they would offer to make more for you). My biggest complaint was the service. We stayed 10 nights. Upon checking in, you are made aware that full cleaning services for your room will be given on your 3rd and 5th day of the stay. We got one our 3rd day (but only because I asked) and we finally got one on our 9th day (after I told the manager the cleaning lady did not show up the previous day as promised - even after asking that day too). Both times it was half-assed (sorry, but there is no better way to describe it). At one cleaning, the lady told me she would bring clean towels to us later, as they were being washed - we never got them; we had to go for them ourselves. At the other cleaning, she forgot to empty out one of the trash cans (when you only get a cleaning 2x/wk, you need both cans emptied). There was also a problem with the satellite service so we only got about 12 channels. We arrived on a Saturday and the manager said someone would be coming during the week to fix it; it still had not been fixed by the time we checked out; the remote control was a problem as well - I had to get it exchanged 3 times before I got one that kind of worked; I overheard another guest having a similar problem with their remote. When we were getting ready to checkout @ 7:30 a.m., I tried to use the luggage cart so we wouldn't have to make several trips back and forth to our car, the clerk didn't know where it was. We were in a rush to meet other people so I didn't bother asking him to find it. The staff is nice, but there is definitely no sense of urgency on their part. Normally, this is not a problem with me, but there were just too many basic things that were not as they should be, and too much prompting from me to get things done, so the flip attitude was exhausting. It's unfortunate because the price is good for what you get in terms of accommodations, but the inadequate service frustrated me too much and really made my husband angry, which for him is saying a lot, as he is the most patient and tolerant person I know. He said, "We will NOT be staying here again!" Maybe it was just a bad week for them (the electricity went out of the hotel for a few hours as well one day, and the elevator was out for at least a day on another occasion), but I'm not willing to take another chance staying, even at the low prices.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but overcharged by $602.56”
Reviews.Author: RoxMac
Reviews.Content: Room was nice stayed 1 night. Got my credit card bill a month later and found two charges - one for the $86 for 1 night and another for $602.56. When I called I was told 3 times I would get a call back and never did. I called & called and finally I was told that we were there for 7 nights! Not! I explained to 2 different people & a manager that we were not there except for 1 night and basically was told I was lying. Mgr called me back & said housekeeping cleaned on the days they were supposed to. Obviously they were covering their behinds for "cleaning" a vacant room. Finally I offered up the bill from the hotel we DID stay at to get them to reverse the charges. Just faxed it to them - let's see if we actually get refund!? Don't know if an employee is ripping them off somehow or they are just stupid. Watch your bill if you dare stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Worst in 50 yrs.”
Reviews.Author: scott57049
Reviews.Content: This place could be in a horror film. By far the worst staff no maids down to one only i was told by the front desk man. They clean the rooms every 3rd day! Breakfast no attention always having to ask for things. I truly felt like all they wanted was our money and the rest was up to us. We had to take out garbage take down dirty towels ect. for new (cleaner) ones. I got the impression that it was a family that was running things. The bottom line was there only concern$$$$ . Never will even stay near this place, Stinky ,dirty filthy. And I am not that picky really! I am a Camper ,Hunter. But I have my limits. Terrible....

Reviews.Title: “Stinky”
Reviews.Author: Chilkoot_Hiker
Reviews.Content: The hallways stink of smoke, and even if your room is non-smoking the smell inevitably seeps in. If they are going to allow smoking they should segregate by floor. The room was a little tired but ok, with a kitchenette, in-room coffee, comfortable bed, and good wifi. The hotel's address is on the interstate frontage road but it's actually set back quite a ways by a long access driveway so was pretty quiet. Breakfast was the usual waffles, bread, and yogurt. Nothing special but adequate. It's the cheapest option I found in this part of town, and ok for a couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: CoachJames
Reviews.Content: I traveld to Phoenix for a meeting at a convention center close by. Terri and her staff were very friendly and helpful and I had a great stay and I am on my computer a lot and the internet worked great also. There is a huge mall close by with lots of restaurants so I did not have to go far for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Metro Center Area”
Reviews.Author: Brad702
Reviews.Content: I'm from texas and I travel to Arizona (Phoenix MetroCenter area ) occasionally. Out of all the hotels and motels in this area, the MainStay suites was the best place to stay. The staff is great, the rooms are awesome with full sized refridgerators and stove tops. This makes it easy for me to stay here for weeks at a time.

Reviews.Title: “Uncooperative and unorganized staff”
Reviews.Author: Tripor
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at this hotel and went to check in I was rudely told that I did not have a room reserved. There was no offer for me to check in, so I left and walked over to Townplace Suites who were very kind and charged less than Mainstay. I was surprized to see that I was charged for the room even though I did not stay there.. When I called to question the bill a horel representitive said that I should have checked in even though I was told I did not have a reservation, and that is why I was considered a "no show". She would not reverse charges. I stated that I was not a no show and that I did in fact try to check in. She raised her voice and told me that I was a "no show" and that is why my credit card was charged without my authorizatrion. I am sooo concerned that my credit card is compromised by this rude staff. DO NOT GIVE THIS HOTEL YOUR CREDIT CARD NUMBER..

Reviews.Title: “fair decent clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: freykr
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay here in Feb. 07, I basically stayed here because all of my favorite hotels were booked, some fairly dumpy hotels were available at outrageous prices, but I remembered seeing this one near another hotel I previously stayed at so I looked it up online and found a room at a fair price near Phoenix Metro Centre here at Mainstay. The room was clean, it's a semi suite, has a fridge, microwave, high speed internet. The facility is fairly new and modern, the pool is nice. There are picnic tables and BBQs for guests. A comp breakfast in the morning. The staff is average, no complaints, but no reason to praise either. It's not my favorite hotel in the area, but in a pinch it worked our real nice. Clean decent at a fair price during busy season. [$139]

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: MyTrip2
Reviews.Content: Very pleasantly surprised to discover a sweet, clean, modern room on a chance stay using hotel points! A great location if you're on your way north but find it too late to keep driving. Off the freeway enough to keep noise at bay. A little unknown gem in the Choice Hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: dee2673
Reviews.Content: Another very inexpensive, very clean, nice little place..We felt safe..It was in a decent area..lots of restaurants and bars nearby.. It had a full kitchen and laundry facilities..I don't know WHERE else I could get that much for 80.00 a night!

Reviews.Title: “Frequent Guest - Great Hotel for Price $”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great Staff & Hotel. Conveniently located in North Phx area. I stay at this hotel 2-3 days each week for business for the past 2 yrs & LOVE it. Front Desk & Housekeeping staff are wonderful & know who I am. Open spacious rooms with fully equipped kitchen allows me to eat in & not spend a lot on going out to eat. I have referred numerous business associates & friends & they also really enjoyed it. Yum Yum - cookies baked nightly & like those frequent traveler points that this hotel offers.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful of theft.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a business trip in Nov. 2004. It is a clean hotel, with nice rooms, and I had stayed at this hotel when it was Sierra Suites twice before, with no problems. My experience this time included theft from my room. The hotel manager did not believe that this could have occurred. There were 8 of us in 8 separate rooms on the first floor. We were working nights and the hotel staff was aware of this. Since we worked nights, we slept during the day. The windows in 6 of our 8 rooms had been set up so that they were not secured, which was found after I had been ripped off. It was obvious that the screen had been removed and the room entered through the window. Phoenix Police were called to the room and it was apparent to them that the burglary occurred as described. Still, the hotel would not acknowledge that this could have occurred. I was disappointed in the hotel manager and her handling of this incident. It was implied that I was a liar and making up the entire story. I would not recommend that anyone stay at this hotel since I'm sure the employee who set this up was never found out. Find a different place to stay when visiting the Phoenix area.

HotelInfo.Name: Mainstay Suites Metro Center
HotelInfo.Address: 9455 North Black Canyon Highway, Phoenix, AZ 85021 (Formerly Sierra Suites)
